parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A physician. From iaomai; a physician.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To spend, bear expense, waste, squander. From dapane; to expend, i.e. to incur cost, or to waste.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular

str2: Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.
